g.text: Elementary perceptual tasks are performed to extract
quantitative information. The tasks are ordered
by performance accuracy and graphical forms
should employ elements from as high up on
the hierarchy as possible. The tasks are:
The gestalt laws describe our perception of visual
elements and their relationships particularly in
grouping and recognizing patterns. These laws
This taxonomy was developed from an experimental
which can be used to determine the
efficacy of the visual. The tasks
describe graphical integrity in always showing the
taxonomy acts as guidelines for accurately
must be proportional to their numerical
This taxonomy was developped for an experimental
study on visualization recognition and recall. The
techniques to aid in the memorability of
Image schema are subconcious representations of
the recurring dynamics we encounter that help us
understand the world around us. These
The schemas fall into six major
The use of narrative visualization allows a designer
to use sequence as a tool to highlight data
sequencing allows a designer to implement
that draws the audience’s attention to
Data storytelling implements narrative patterns to
help orient the audience within the intent of the

text.tspan: Length is used here in the length of the lines
as an indicator of number of assignments
for each course.
Relative sized is used in this visual in the
area of the “petals” that form a half pie
chart. The area represents the relative
amount of time spent on a course’s assign
ments in comparison to other courses.
Tufte’s principles focus heavily on graphical
integrity. In this visual the lengths of the
lines to indicate number of assignments
have been accurately mapped with each
increase in number of assignments being
equivalent to one increase in unite of
length. The percentage of semester com
plete is also accurately proportioned to the
length of the arc.
One of the main visual tasks for this
visualization is correlation. Each pie chart
slice and line correspond to a one class. The
proximity of the glyphs allows for
comparison between the two variables and
draw conclusions about the correlation in
time spent on coursework and number of
assignemnts.
In this visual memorability is enhanced
through an axis to aid in comprehension of
the number of assignments indicators.
Additionally, text has been provided to
indicate the percentage of the semester
completed so the audience doesn’t have to
make assumptions about the value.
The containment schema is utilized here as
the entire half circle arc indicates 100% and
the amount that the arc is “filled in” out of
100% capacity indicates the percentage of
the semester completed.
A subcategory of the framing method of
data storytelling is metaphor. This graphical
form utilizes metaphor to build a flower like
shape with the pie chart slices being the
petals and the lines being the stem. Meta
phor provides a platform for the audience to
build their comprehension of the overall
purpose of the data visual, which here
might be to show how individual course
work :blossomed” throughout the semester
to create one holistic body of work.
Narrative sequencing is used in this web
page to allow the user to explore the various
taxonomies of visual cognition at their own
pace and select, examine, and re-examine,
the different categories. The highlighting of
the glyphs in the data visual that corre
spond to the selected taxonomy allows for
comparison between the taxonomies in how
they build upon eachother and overlap to
provide value to a component of the visual.
